filename: Luvison et al. - 2013 - Pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules are of donor origin in lung allografts.pdf

fields_extracted.case_count_quote: Two cases comprised the study group.
fields_extracted.patient_sex_quote: One woman (Case 1) received a male lung allograft for idiopathic pulmonary /uniFB01 brosis and had MPMN identi /uniFB01 ed at 1.1 years post-transplant; the other (Case 2) was a male recipient of a female lung allograft
fields_extracted.presenting_symptoms_quote: Minute pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules (MPMNs) are asymptomatic small nodules representing incidental microscopic /uniFB01 ndings in lung specimens.
fields_extracted.diagnostic_method_quote: MPMNs can be seen as an incidental /uniFB01 nding in surveillance transbronchial biopsies performed on lung allograft recipients.
fields_extracted.histopathology: Nests or whorls of moderately sized epithelioid cells centered on small veins with elongated or spindled cells, oval nuclei, fine granular chromatin and inconspicuous nucleoli, with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm showing poorly defined cell borders
fields_extracted.histopathology_quote: Microscopically, the lesions consist of nests or whorls of moderately sized epithelioid cells centered on small veins with the cells being elongated or spindled with oval nuclei, /uniFB01 ne granular chromatin and inconspicuous nucleoli, with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm showing poorly de /uniFB01 ned cell borders.
fields_extracted.immunohistochemistry: Positive for epithelial membrane antigen and vimentin; negative for cytokeratin, actin, S100 protein, CD34, chromogranin, synaptophysin, and CD68
fields_extracted.immunohistochemistry_quote: On the basis of immunohistochemical stains, primarily positivity for epithelial membrane antigen and vimentin, and negative studies for cytokeratin, actin, S100 protein, CD34, chromogranin and synaptophysin... Immunostains showed the MPMN cells to stain for epithelial membrane antigen and vimentin and to not express CD68, a histiocytic marker.
fields_extracted.comorbidities: Case 1: idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis; Case 2: severe smoking-induced bronchiolitis obliterans
fields_extracted.comorbidities_quote: One woman (Case 1) received a male lung allograft for idiopathic pulmonary /uniFB01 brosis... the other (Case 2) was a male recipient of a female lung allograft for severe smoking-induced bronchiolitis obliterans
fields_extracted.filename: Luvison et al. - 2013 - Pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules are of donor origin in lung allografts.pdf
fields_extracted.extraction_notes: The paper focuses on proving that MPMNs in lung transplant recipients originate from donor tissue using XY chromosome analysis. The clinical details are limited as this was not the main focus. Some information like patient ages and specific outcomes are not reported.
